intro: Ganua curtisii, commonly known as the Curtis's ganua, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or clay soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Ganua curtisii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
